articles.title: The 25 biggest stadiums in world soccer
articles.description: Reuters/Albert Gea The 25 biggest stadiums in world soccer have a combined capacity of over 2.15 million. Amongst them are arenas from six different continents — Asia, Australasia, Europe, North America, South America, and Africa. Read below to find out which…

articles.title: China will start destroying cash collected in areas with high exposure to the coronavirus
articles.description: The People's Bank of China announced it will begin destroying notes collected by hospitals, buses, and markets in coronavirus-addles locales, financial news outlet Caixin reported. China's central bank will also disinfect some bills and store them for 14 days…

articles.author: Aria Bendix
articles.title: A 21-year-old Canadian woman in Wuhan says she won't evacuate because she can't abandon her cat. Here's what her life is like under lockdown.
articles.description: Kristina Shramko, a 21-year-old Canadian citizen, is quarantined in Wuhan, China, amid the deadly coronavirus outbreak. The entire city of Wuhan is under lockdown, along with other cities throughout China's Hubei province. Shramko said she has refused to leav…
articles.content:
Kristina Shramko hasn't been outside in a full week.
The last time she left her loft in Wuhan, China, officers in the supermarket across the street checked her temperature before she entered the store to buy groceries. She wore a mask — a requirement in Wuha… [+5826 chars]

articles.author: Linette Lopez
articles.title: The coronavirus could cripple China's economy for longer than Wall Street wants to believe
articles.description: Wall Street is convincing itself that China will bounce back relatively quickly around the end of the first quarter, when it expects the coronavirus' spread to be contained. This is banker delusion. China's economy is growing much more slowly than it was in 2…
articles.content:
The coronavirus is still spreading throughout China, but all over Wall Street, a consensus about the virus' economic influence is already solidifying.
The thinking goes like this: China will slowly get back to work by the end of the first quarter. Investors … [+6048 chars]

articles.title: Facebook canceled an annual San Francisco conference because of coronavirus concerns

articles.content:
Facebook is canceling an annual conference held in San Francisco out of health concerns regarding the coronavirus.

articles.title: POLICY SHORTFALL: US government is less equipped to handle coronavirus and support citizens than the East Asian countries that have already been hit
articles.description: We analyzed sick leave policies in the countries with some of the highest reported rates of coronavirus, and contrasted them with US federal employment policies — and those of some states. Unlike the East and Southeast Asian countries near the center of the o…
